lodging.name: Hotel Navona Colors

itinerary.title: Arrival in Paris

transport.notes: Driver will meet at arrivals with name sign

activities.name: Arrive & Check-in
activities.description: Settle into your Le Marais hotel. Take a leisurely stroll through the neighborhood to shake off jet lag.

activities.name: Seine River Walk
activities.description: Walk along the Seine as the sun sets. Cross to Île de la Cité to see Notre-Dame's exterior restoration.

activities.name: Welcome Dinner
activities.description: Classic French bistro in Le Marais. Try the duck confit or steak frites paired with local wine.

recommendations.name: Chez Janou
recommendations.description: Famous for chocolate mousse and Provençal cuisine. Lively atmosphere near Place des Vosges.

recommendations.name: Le Petit Cler
recommendations.description: Cozy neighborhood bistro with seasonal menu. Perfect find near the Eiffel Tower area.

tips: Free: Window shop along Rue des Francs-Bourgeois for vintage finds
Free: Peek into hidden courtyards - many Le Marais buildings have beautiful interior gardens

itinerary.title: Iconic Paris

activities.name: Eiffel Tower - Skip the Line Summit Access
activities.description: Beat the crowds with an early morning timed entry. Summit access for panoramic views of the city. Includes host guide for elevator access.

activities.name: Trocadéro Gardens
activities.description: Cross to Trocadéro for the classic Eiffel Tower photo op. Lovely gardens to explore.

activities.name: Louvre Museum - Guided Highlights Tour
activities.description: 2-hour guided tour hitting the must-sees: Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, Winged Victory. Skip-the-line entry and audio headsets included.

activities.name: Dinner in Saint-Germain-des-Prés
activities.description: Cross to the Left Bank for dinner in the literary quarter. Café de Flore or Les Deux Magots for atmosphere.

tips: Free: Walk through the Tuileries Garden between Louvre and Place de la Concorde
Free: Browse the bouquinistes (book stalls) along the Seine

itinerary.title: Hidden Paris & Food Tour

activities.name: Montmartre Food & Wine Tour
activities.description: 3-hour walking tour through the artistic Montmartre neighborhood. Visit 8 local cheese shops, bakeries, chocolate makers, and wine bars with tastings at each stop.

activities.name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
activities.description: Free entry to the stunning white-domed basilica. Climb to the dome for city views or relax on the steps watching street performers.

activities.name: Artist Square (Place du Tertre)
activities.description: Browse local artists at work. Fun spot for a caricature or small painting souvenir.

activities.name: Final Paris Evening
activities.description: Farewell dinner at a Michelin-recommended bistro, or keep it casual with wine and cheese in the hotel neighborhood.

tips: Free: Walk through the Montmartre vineyard, one of the last working vineyards in Paris
Free: Explore the quiet streets behind Sacré-Cœur - charming village feel away from tourists

itinerary.title: Paris to Rome

activities.name: Leisurely Departure
activities.description: Enjoy a final Parisian breakfast. Coffee and croissant at a neighborhood café.

activities.name: Flight to Rome
activities.description: Short 2-hour flight from Paris CDG to Rome FCO.
activities.notes: Flight cost included in trip total

activities.name: Arrive in Rome & Check-in
activities.description: Transfer to your Trastevere hotel. This charming neighborhood feels like the 'real Rome' with cobblestone streets and local trattorias.

activities.name: Trastevere Evening Stroll
activities.description: Get lost in the atmospheric streets. End at Piazza di Santa Maria for people-watching.

activities.name: Roman Dinner
activities.description: Authentic Roman cuisine: cacio e pepe, carbonara, or amatriciana. Book a table at a local trattoria.

tips: Free: The Trastevere neighborhood is beautiful for evening walks - every corner is photogenic
Free: Santa Maria in Trastevere church has stunning Byzantine mosaics (free entry)

itinerary.title: Ancient Rome

activities.name: Colosseum, Forum & Palatine - Priority Access
activities.description: Comprehensive guided tour of Ancient Rome's heart. Skip all lines with priority access. Audio headsets provided so you hear every word of the guide's commentary.

activities.name: Lunch Near Campo de' Fiori
activities.description: Walk to this lively market square for fresh produce, flowers, and casual lunch options.

activities.name: Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps
activities.description: Hit the iconic spots. Toss a coin in Trevi (guarantees your return to Rome!). Walk up the Spanish Steps for views.

activities.name: Aperitivo Hour
activities.description: Experience the Roman tradition of pre-dinner drinks with complimentary snacks. The hotel neighborhood or Piazza Navona area both excellent.

tips: Free: The Pantheon is free to enter - arrive early or late to avoid peak crowds
Free: Window shop along Via del Corso and Via Condotti (luxury designer row)

itinerary.title: Vatican & Farewell

activities.name: Vatican Museums & Sistine Chapel - Early Entry
activities.description: Special early access before crowds. Guided tour through the museums including Raphael Rooms, culminating in the Sistine Chapel. St. Peter's Basilica entry included via special passageway.

activities.name: Castel Sant'Angelo (Optional)
activities.description: Former papal fortress with excellent views from the rooftop terrace. Skip if museum'd out.

activities.name: Gelato Quest
activities.description: Sample Rome's famous gelato. Favorites: Giolitti (classic), Fatamorgana (creative flavors), Come Il Latte (pure ingredients).

activities.name: Farewell Dinner with a View
activities.description: Special last-night dinner. Rooftop restaurant with view of the dome of St. Peter's, or intimate Trastevere gem.

tips: Free: St. Peter's Square is stunning at any time but magical at sunset
Free: Walk across Ponte Sant'Angelo - the bridge with Bernini's angels

activities.name: Final Morning in Rome
activities.description: Depending on flight time: sleep in, final neighborhood wander, or quick visit to any missed spots.

activities.name: Airport Transfer & Flight Home
activities.description: Private transfer to FCO airport. Arrivederci, Roma!

hiddenGems.name: Le Marais Jewish Quarter
hiddenGems.description: Wander the narrow streets of the historic Jewish quarter for the best falafel in Paris at L'As du Fallafel, vintage shops, and gorgeous hidden courtyards. Most tourists miss the beautiful interior gardens visible through archways.
hiddenGems.tip: Visit on a Sunday when other neighborhoods are quiet but Le Marais is bustling.

hiddenGems.name: Promenade Plantée
hiddenGems.description: An elevated park built on an old railway line—the inspiration for NYC's High Line. Walk 4.5km from Bastille through treetops, gardens, and tunnels. Feels like a secret only Parisians know.
hiddenGems.tip: Start at Bastille and walk east for the best experience. Ends at Bois de Vincennes.

hiddenGems.name: Trastevere at Golden Hour
hiddenGems.description: Cross the river to Rome's most romantic neighborhood. The ochre buildings glow at sunset, and the winding cobblestone streets feel like stepping back in time. Stay for dinner at a local trattoria.
hiddenGems.tip: Arrive around 6pm, grab a gelato, and wander until you find the perfect dinner spot.

hiddenGems.name: Aventine Keyhole
hiddenGems.description: At the Knights of Malta gate on Aventine Hill, peek through the famous keyhole for a perfectly framed view of St. Peter's dome. Magical at sunset and rarely crowded.
hiddenGems.tip: Combine with the peaceful Orange Garden (Giardino degli Aranci) next door for Rome's best sunset views.

localCustoms.title: Greeting Etiquette
localCustoms.description: In France, it's customary to greet shopkeepers with 'Bonjour' when entering and 'Au revoir' when leaving. In Italy, 'Buongiorno' (good morning/day) or 'Buonasera' (good evening) works similarly.
localCustoms.doThis: Say 'Bonjour/Buongiorno' when entering shops, restaurants, or elevators
localCustoms.avoidThis: Walking into a shop and immediately asking for something without greeting first

localCustoms.title: Dining Pace
localCustoms.description: Europeans dine leisurely. In both Paris and Rome, a meal is an experience—expect 1.5-2 hours minimum. Waiters won't rush you or bring the check until you ask.
localCustoms.doThis: Signal for the check when ready by saying 'L'addition' (France) or 'Il conto' (Italy)
localCustoms.avoidThis: Expecting the check to arrive automatically—it's considered rude to rush diners

localCustoms.title: Café Culture
localCustoms.description: In Paris, standing at the bar for coffee is cheaper than sitting at a table. In Rome, a quick espresso at the bar is the local way—Italians rarely sit for coffee during the day.
localCustoms.doThis: Try the local way: order 'un caffè' standing at an Italian bar
localCustoms.avoidThis: Ordering a cappuccino after 11am in Italy—locals only drink it at breakfast

localCustoms.title: Church Dress Code
localCustoms.description: Both countries require covered shoulders and knees in churches. St. Peter's and the Vatican are strict; Notre-Dame area churches are more relaxed but still respectful.
localCustoms.doThis: Carry a light scarf or shawl for impromptu church visits
localCustoms.avoidThis: Wearing shorts, tank tops, or revealing clothing to major religious sites

freeActivities.name: Pantheon
freeActivities.description: This 2,000-year-old temple has a stunning dome with an open oculus letting in dramatic shafts of light. One of the best-preserved ancient Roman buildings.
freeActivities.bestTime: Arrive early morning (8:30am) or late afternoon to avoid peak crowds

freeActivities.name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
freeActivities.description: Stunning white-domed church with panoramic city views from the steps. Free entry to the basilica interior. Street performers and artists add to the atmosphere.
freeActivities.bestTime: Sunset for magical views over Paris

freeActivities.name: Tuileries Garden
freeActivities.description: Historic formal garden stretching from the Louvre to Place de la Concorde. Perfect for a peaceful stroll, people-watching, or renting a classic green chair by the pond.
freeActivities.bestTime: Morning for photos, afternoon for relaxing

freeActivities.name: Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps
freeActivities.description: Two of Rome's most iconic landmarks are free to visit. Toss a coin in Trevi (tradition says you'll return to Rome) and climb the Spanish Steps for views.
freeActivities.bestTime: Very early morning (7am) or late evening to avoid massive crowds

freeActivities.name: Seine River Walk & Bouquinistes
freeActivities.description: Walk along the riverbanks and browse the famous green bookstalls (bouquinistes). Cross to Île de la Cité for views of Notre-Dame's restoration.
freeActivities.bestTime: Golden hour for beautiful photos of the bridges

freeActivities.name: Piazza Navona
freeActivities.description: Rome's most beautiful baroque square with three ornate fountains, street artists, and people-watching cafés. The architecture is the main attraction—and it's free.
freeActivities.bestTime: Evening when the fountains are lit and locals come out to stroll

essentials: Universal power adapter (Type C/F for Europe)
recommended: Small umbrella or packable rain jacket
Layers—even summer evenings can be cool
Reusable water bottle (Rome has drinking fountains!)
Good camera or phone for photos
packingTips.weather: June in Paris and Rome: warm days (70-85°F / 21-29°C), cooler evenings. Occasional rain possible. Pack light layers, a light jacket for evenings, and one nicer outfit for elegant dinners.
